issue.title: Phishing websites
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

According to official sources, there're no such foundations and organisations. They're fake, instead of giving scholarships to students, they defraud them and ask for identity information and IBAN:
```
bilsevvakfi.org
ogrencilerbirligi.com
```
People are asked for credentials and all people believe this method. Some people are also being asked to send money from their papara account. Some websites even ask people for an address and IBAN (rarely):
```
lcwpaketleme.com
herkeseuygunisilanlari.com
cagrievi.com
kariyerfirsatin.com.tr
cartepak.online
aryapaketleme.com
```

### Proposed solution

Can you please block these websites?

### Additional information

_No response_

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/178790

comment.body:
In AdGuard settings please change IP address in `Hide your IP address` to another one or add this rule:
```adblock
@@||centrecom.com.au^$stealth=ip
```
to user rules.

issue.title: m.cafe.naver.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://m.cafe.naver.com/ca-fe/unrealfx](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fm.cafe.naver.com%2Fca-fe%2Funrealfx) ### Comment > Additional Details: > There seems to be a site issue m.cafe.naver.com when Tracking URL is blocked, causing massive memory leaks. > > Reproduction steps: > 1. Enable AdGuard Tracking Protection Filter > 2. Load https://m.cafe.naver.com/ca-fe/unrealfx > 3. Scroll down a few times to trigger infinite scrolling > 4. Check memory consumption > 5. Continuing to scroll in mobile will cause forced refresh/tab crash due to OOM > > JS Heap without Adguard: 400 MB > JS Heap with AdGuard: 1.1 GB (and counting) > > Checking network requests blocked: > 804 network requests when using AdGuard w/ Tracking Protection Filter (refresh): > https://scv-cafe.io.naver.com/jackpotlog/v1/logs -> 232 blocked > https://nelo2-col.navercorp.com/_store -> 346 blocked > > 840 network requests without AdGuard: > https://scv-cafe.io.naver.com/jackpotlog/v1/logs -> 456 requests (None blocked) > https://nelo2-col.navercorp.com/_store -> no requests sent > > **Note:** Issue is also replicable on Chrome desktop using uBlock and Tracking Protection filter. > > Issue can also be replicated without any adblockers by directly blocking the URLs in DevTools inspect. Username: `@mpccelon` ### Screenshots

Specific filters causing the issue:
```
https://scv-cafe.io.naver.com/jackpotlog/v1/logs
||scv-cafe.io.naver.com/jackpotlog/*/logs$xhr
```
